Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: By the end of Level 2, students access and show familiarity with digital systems and use them for a purpose.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students identify patterns and represent data in different ways.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They use the basic features of common digital tools to create, locate and share content for an audience.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students share content and collaborate following agreed behaviours.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They recognise and explain how digital tools may store their personal data online.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students explain and solve simple problems.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They follow and represent basic algorithms involving a sequence of steps, branching and iteration.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students explain how digital systems meet the needs of known users.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: By the end of Level 4, students securely access and use digital systems and their peripherals for a range of purposes.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They explain how data is transmitted between digital systems.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students represent different types of data for different purposes.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They organise and present different types of data using software tools.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students use the core features of common digital tools to create, locate and communicate content for an audience.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They use digital tools to plan tasks, share content and collaborate following agreed behaviours.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students identify and recognise the risks to their personal data in online accounts.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students describe simple problems and list requirements.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They describe and represent simple algorithms involving branching and iteration.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students design simple user interfaces and compare their designs.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They implement simple algorithms as visual programs.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students describe how student-created solutions meet the provided requirements.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: By the end of Level 6, students securely access and use multiple digital systems and accounts, and describe their components.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They describe how data is transmitted within networks.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students describe how digital systems represent data.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They acquire and manipulate data using spreadsheets.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students interpret and visualise data using spreadsheets.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They select and use appropriate digital tools to create, locate and communicate content, applying common conventions.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students use digital tools to plan tasks, share content online and collaborate on projects, following agreed behaviours.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They identify their digital footprint, recognise its permanence and consider privacy when collecting data.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students define problems with functional requirements.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They design algorithms involving complex branching and iteration.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students design and modify user interfaces and evaluate the designs.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They implement algorithms as visual programs including variables and input.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students explain how student-created digital solutions meet the functional requirements of users.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: By the end of Level 8, students select appropriate hardware for particular tasks.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They explain how data is transmitted and secured in networks.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students identify and describe cyber security threats.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students represent data using integers and binary.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They acquire, manipulate and validate data using spreadsheets and single-table databases.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students interpret, model and visualise data using spreadsheets and database queries to draw conclusions.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They select and use a range of digital tools to create, locate and communicate content, applying common conventions.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students use a range of digital tools to plan tasks, share content online, and manage individual and collaborative iterative projects.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They manage their digital footprint and privacy when collecting data.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students define and decompose real-world problems, and determine functional requirements and constraints.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They design and trace algorithms using flowcharts and pseudocode.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students design and modify user interfaces and user experiences, and evaluate alternative designs.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They implement algorithms and debug programs using a general-purpose programming language.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students evaluate digital solutions against the functional requirements.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: By the end of Level 10, students explain how digital systems manage, control and secure access to data in networks.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They model and evaluate cyber security threats and vulnerabilities.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students describe a range of data compression techniques.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They represent documents as content, structure and markup.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students acquire, manipulate and validate data using spreadsheets and relational databases.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They interpret, model and visualise data using spreadsheets, and relational databases using queries, to draw conclusions and identify trends.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students use advanced features of digital tools to create and communicate interactive content for an audience.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They use project management tools to plan and manage individual and collaborative iterative projects.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students identify and apply privacy principles to manage digital footprints.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students decompose real-world problems, identify needs, and determine functional and non-functional requirements.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They design, validate and test algorithms using flowcharts and pseudocode.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students design and prototype user interfaces and user experiences, and evaluate alternative designs against design criteria.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: They implement algorithms and debug programs using an object-oriented programming language.

Subject: Digital Technologies
Text: Students critically evaluate digital solutions against user needs and the functional and non-functional requirements.
